text: How to create Classes in Python with highly constrained instances
In Python, there are examples of built-in classes with highly constrained instances.
For example,  "None" is the only instance of its class, and in the bool class there are only two objects, "True" and "False"  (I hope I am more-or-less correct so far).
Another good example are integers: if a and b are instances of the int type then a == b  implies that a is b.
